New Records: Coby White made a career-high nine 3-pointers.
Key Match Events: Coby White scored 33 points, hitting 9 of 11 from beyond the arc.
Zach LaVine also scored 33 points, marking his third 30-point outing in the past four games.
Nikola Vucevic added 22 points and 12 rebounds.
Josh Giddey contributed 15 points, 10 rebounds, and eight assists.
Karl-Anthony Towns led the Knicks with 44 points and 16 rebounds.
Jalen Brunson scored 33 points for the Knicks.
Josh Hart added 16 rebounds for the Knicks.
The Bulls outscored the Knicks 41-17 in the third quarter, turning a nine-point halftime deficit into a 104-89 advantage.
Post-Match Reflections: The team honored Derrick Rose at halftime, announcing that his number will be retired by the franchise next season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks have back-to-back losses for the third time this season.
The Bulls shook off a sluggish first half and dominated down the stretch.
